title: It seems to me that ap masteries are a bit fucked up.
body:
I played a game as jungle diana today, with my newly made masteries. I wasn't even able to clear red, though it had been a piece of cake one patch earlier. 
Is It only me or should I accuse the mastery system?  

In case it's only my problem, what mastery/rune pages would you recommend in this patch(mainly {{champion:131}} in mind? :)

replies.body: from what i hear a lot of jungler are having a hard time clearing, and honestly the new masteries were buffs to certain ap champs i feel and slight nerfs to others

I think that bursty champions were kind of nerfed, the Keystones in offensive don't really help out bursty AP champions like Leblanc who go 12-18 instead of 18-12. While sustained damage like Zyra and Cassiopeia were fairly buffed with the Deathfire Keystone. (2 Liandrys).

Any bursty champ shouldnt use deathfire. I think alot of people still have that instinct of "I'm a dmg carry, I need to go full ferocity" when in fact, for most burst champs, Thunderlord's Decree is the strongest choice.

Negative.

Thunder only has 10% AP whilst torch has 20%. The later also has no CD, if you do whatever type of poke to soften up, torch is better.
uhm? Thunderlord's Decree is a better Luden's Echo proc, for free. Tons of burst mages would rather have that than a DoT. The Thunderlord's base damage scales with level, while Deathfire does not.
The thing is, if a champion has high and safe DPS with their spells, i.e. Cass, Azir, or Zyra, they can make good use of Deathfire Touch unlike most other mages

Don't know if other people have commented on this, but I have pretty optimized runes for jungling so that's helped a lot. I also tend to go HPx3 instead of refillable, since it gives a much much stronger start. To get Hunter's Potion you have to spend the equivalent of 8 Health Pots, so a lot of times I think it's a lot better to just buy HP until Hunter's Potion gets buffed.

For Jungle Diana you should be going AS marks, armor seals, AP glyphs, and AP quints, all flat. It's a weird page but Diana is a weird champ, AS is the best mark for jungling and Diana does well with AS, and you need the raw offensive stats for your first clears. This is also the same page for lane Diana, save swapping scaling HP for seals and scaling AP for glyphs (both are preference).

Yeah I feel like hunters potion is a joke right now.

Hunter's Potion is only really useful to the members of the cast that can clear okay but require mana to do it. Since it refreshes on large monster kills, it can be super useful on some champs in the jungle to increase their sustain. However, it can be a trap on some champs that don't utilize it as well as others...

I tried doing a clear as Diana in a custom game (so no leash).  

Runes: Attack Speed Marks, AP Quints, Flat Armor Seals, Scaling MR Glyphs
Masteries: 12/18/0 [Thunderlord's Decree]
Starting Items: Hunter's Talisman, 3 Health Potions
Ability Order: WQWE

I cleared the following camps in order: Krugs (smite), Raptors, Red Buff (Smite), Blue Buff, Wolves.

I finished 1 camp short of level 4 with enough gold to purchase my Jungle Item and ~250HP left.  This is without killing a Scuttle Crab for extra healing.
------------------
Did you start with the Refillable Potion?  That gives you 250 less HP on the initial clear than 3 Health Potions.

Honestly, I wouldn't recommend starting Refillable Potion on anyone unless you plan on immediately backing after your first clear to buy.  It doesn't leave you with enough health after clearing 4/5 camps to gank lanes and the healing (200HP per back) is negligible.

You don't really need to upgrade it into Hunter's Potion either.  I find that by the time I have finished my Smite upgrade, I no longer have sustain problems clearing the jungle. 
----------------
While I've only played three junglers thus far (Rammus [Machete], Xin Zhao [Machete], Diana [Machete]), I have had no problems clearing on any of them.

Ok, so that  was the problem! Confusing potions XD

I'd like to see your masteries before saying anything, really. I know Elise clears fine in season 5, but I've heard complaints about Nidalee in contrast. I feel like everyone's unsure about their masteries and might be making bad choices though.

The "AP Assassin" class is mostly dead right now.  (Oh no.  No LB or Fizz.  Whatever will we do.) 

So if you're a mage, the masteries you can pick from are either tankiness/sustain or next to nothing outside of a little extra damage (although Ionian Boots and Boots of Swiftness are dirt cheap now; you might have a reason to get those early on if you're squishy)...Those essentially are your options.

Since Diana has a nice shield, I'd suggest making use of it and going into the defense masteries, especially if you're jungling.  You get a free ride in the jungle if you take the defensive keystone that gives you max hp when you kill big monsters.

May I ask what runes you're running?  Because regardless of what items you get, if you're runes are wrong.. you're gonna have a bad time.

You need AS Marks, and likely even AS in your Masteries.  AS is essential to EVERY jungler for the best clears.  Not AP.  But you can certainly run both.  Especially on Diana, she wants a lot of both (her passive is amazing).

Ask yourself, whats more important.. surviving and fast clearing your first clears?  Or a little bit of magic pen that helps a tiny bit mid-late game - after you're constantly behind from not being able to gank, because you're dealing with your camps?

Also, start Machete still.. don't listen to recommended items.

It's a mastery nerf to Junglers in general as well.

Old Masteries it was easy to get -2 Jungle Minion Damage, +36 HP, +3% HP, +5% Attack Speed, +2 Auto Attack Damage, +5% CDR (usually had 10% CDR @L1 from runes+mast = more spam with blue on first clear) and some flat AP or AD. You can't get all that anymore, and it adds up to a weaker clear. If you take all the jungle clear stuff you lose out on all the PvP masteries, which is anti-fun. There are some mastery tiers that are useless. I think T3 Ferocity gives 2% Vamp or Scaling AD+AP. 2% Vamp is like 1 HP during your first clear, and scaling stats don't help you when you need them. Even the jungle talents are poor. For instance you can choose between Biscuits or Buff Duration. Buff Duration was designed for Junglers, but Biscuits give you like 90 HP on your first clear which can mean life or death to some champs that have challenging first+second clears.

I'm shocked by how poorly done and ill-conceived this patch was TBH.

The reason you can't clear is because your smite timer is 15 seconds behind, because the new map starts 15 seconds earlier! This was an oversight by Riot, and they will be fixing it. Not being able to smite your 1st and 3rd camps make your clear MUCH harder.

I jungle as Diana and I found that you need the Tough Skin and Insight mastery from the Resolve tree for maximum effectiveness early on.

Despite Diana being AP, I still started with Hunter's Machete as I personally found the Hunter's pot to be absolutely terrible. You either get Hunter's Machete + 3 pots (450 health) or Hunter's potion alone. Plus Hunter's potion doesn't build into any jungle item.


I think Riot really wanted junglers to pick into the Resolve tree instead of Cunning. Now, you either have to choose between Tough Skin, Insight, Vet Scars or Savagery, Merciless, and Dangerous Game.

Also, it helps to get Double Edged Sword on melee champs like Diana and I found the extra damage helps a lot.

My mastery page for Diana: http://puu.sh/llLeM.jpg

Runes: 9x AS marks, 9x Armor marks, 6x CDR/level glyphs + 3x AP glyphs, 3x AP quints

Start: Krugs (smite), Razorbeaks, Red (smite), Blue/Scuttle

AS quints and marks, flat armor seals, flat AP or mr/lvl glyphs. 

AS is the most efficient rune for jungle clearing on nearly all champions, and it's just that much better on Diana with her every 3rd hit mechanic. It's also even stronger with the on-hit damage from machete instead of DoT. 

If you aren't a tank or Lee Sin you should be using AS marks and Quints in the jungle.
